name: Number 11 Exclusive Guesthouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was perfect. Warm welcome, house, atmosphere, location, attention to every single detail. It is warm and lovely, right place to spend a weekend in this great city.
reviews.title: Just Perfect - Love is all around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were lucky to spend one night in the suite, which is gorgeous.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: Would highly recommend and come again for sure.
reviews.title: not sick of number 11

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: P.S.
reviews.title: Recent Stay at Number 11 Exclusive Guesthouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note that if you arrive by car there is a big parking 10 minutes walking distance from the hotel for a reasonable price.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.text: Our stay in no.11 Exclusive Guesthouse is a short one, but the place and the city have left a memory of a life time for us. This place definitely one of a kind and has set a new standard for an excellent and world class bnb. It is perfectly situated in the old area of Brugge. From the bnb, you can easily walk to the city center.
reviews.title: Your Dream Place in Brugge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything in here is just beautiful, the foyer, dining room, living room, kitchen, rooms, and garden are perfect. Hilde and Tania’s are very nice and informative, explaining to us about the city and place to visit, also some recommended restaurants as well. Another thing which I love is the breakfast, it is nicely served and it is so delicious. We stay in the grey room, which was perfect for 3 of us. It has lovely view toward the surrounding area and so comfy. I would love to stay in here again next time I visit this lovely city, Brugge.
reviews.title: Truly amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have organised a weekend trip to Bruges for my boyfriend's birthday and booked suite at Number 11 - we truly loved the place and it was worth every penny. It is like a separate apartment with your own entrance and overlooking gorgeous garden. We loved the decor, the locatin was supeb, close to the center but tucked away from the main road so it was very peaceful and quiet to get a good night sleep. Staff were nice and accommodating.
reviews.title: Charming guesthouse, charming hosts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Honestly, from many places I ahve stayed across the globe this made it to my top list - perfect for a romantice city weekend break if you want to treat yourseves!
reviews.title: Fabulous!!

reviews.text: Just returned from 4 night stay in the Vanilla room at this charming guesthouse. Chose it in the first place due to excellent reviews on tripadvisor and all proved right. As soon as we arrived had a warm welcome from Hilda who was so helpful and just lovely! The guesthouse is in a perfect location, quiet but central, and is beautifully decorated both in communal areas and in our room. Breakfast was substantial and you can help yourself to tea/coffee etc. throughout the day should you need to return for a rest between site seeing. Should we return to Bruges we would defiantly stay at number 11 again. We will be recommending it to all our friends, so much nicer than an impersonal hotel, it really was home from home.
reviews.title: Beautiful Guesthouse in Beautiful Bruges!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed four wonderful restful nights in the very tastefully decorated spacious deluxe suite. Lovely to wake to the sound of birds singing in the garden. In the courtyard we were served a delicious breakfast. This guesthouse has a very quiet convenient location and is kept immaculately clean. Hilde was very helpful with restaurant recommendations (all great!) and pointed out to us all the local sights on a map. At breakfast one morning Tania gave us information about a concert in a local church; was a delightful opportunity to attend. We saw Carine bicycling with a purchase of fresh flowers that grace the rooms. Number 11 is a well managed guesthouse that would be an excellent choice for a visit to Brugge!
reviews.title: Enchanting refuge in one of Europe's most charming cities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful B+B, about a 5-minute walk along the canal to heart of Bruges, on a very quiet side street. Staff was INCREDIBLE; so nice, so friendly, so helpful, whatever we needed or wanted they helped make it happen. Breakfast was delicious, served in their dining room, large choice of breads and jams, yogurts, fresh fruit, hams and cheeses, coffee/tea, eggs if you wanted, chocolates, and biscuits. I am celiac (I let them know ahead of time) and they provided me every day with gluten-free bread and freshly baked chocolate croissants just for me--I was in breakfast heaven! They went out of their way to find these items for me, and it made my stay even more wonderful. The room (Grey and White room) was clean, quiet, beautifully decorated, with a TV and a big bathtub. Steep stairways up to the rooms; that's just the way the architecture is designed, everything is vertical. I have no complaints whatsoever! I would recommend this B+B to anyone and would love to stay there again someday.
reviews.title: Wonderful B+B in Bruges!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for good quality accommodation at a reasonable price look no further than this small Guesthouse (it only has 3 rooms). I thought long and hard when trying to decide what accommodation I was going to book as I wanted the weekend to be a romantic break for my fiancée and I. We were not disappointed. The room (Vanilla room) was superb and very comfortable - very boutique. We didn't manage to make it down for breakfast on the 2 mornings we stayed but the contents of the kitchen were made available to us 24 hours a day. It is within a very pleasant 25 minute walk of the train station and located conveniently for all of the local tourist attractions within the city. I would recommend this location to anyone who is considering staying in Bruges. Thank you to Hilde and Tanya for making our stay a very memorable one.
reviews.title: A 'home from home'

reviews.text: I visited Bruges for four days with two friends and when we arrived at Number 11 we couldn't have received a warmer welcome. Hilde showed us around the gorgeous house, which is close to the centre and one of the beautiful canals, and suggested that we treat it like our home. We were free to use the kitchen for hot drinks etc.and an honesty bar provided us with other refreshments. The house is maintained to a very high standard with real attention to detail. The bedrooms are charming and the beds very comfortable. Breakfast was served in the delightful courtyard garden by Hilde or Tanya (as the ground floor garden suite was unoccupied for part of our stay) which was a real treat for us - good food beautifully served accompanied by sunshine and birdsong - what a way to start the day! Would definitely return.
reviews.title: Something Special

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for a weekend and this was perfect. Great location near one of the canals 5mins walk from the main square. The guest house itself is beautiful, the rooms boutique as in the pictures, spotless and comfy. Nothing was too much trouble and great advice on places to visit and eat at. Waking up to the smell of baking croissants is a perfect way to start the day. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great stay, excellent location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This town is so beautiful and all in a small walk-able area. The Number 11 Guest House was perfect, the breakfast delicious. We stayed in the Chocolate room and loved it! The owners have a large cookie business and leave a box on your pillow when you check in. I would have eaten them every day! Would highly recommend!
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a delight - within a few hundred metres of all that Bruges has to offer, yet so tasteful and so quiet. A warm and friendly welcome, helpful but not intrusive. Our only regret is that we stayed just two nights. We wish we had booked for longer - but perhaps that is the best excuse for going back?
reviews.title: So close to everything, yet so peaceful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights at Number 11 - but wish it could have been longer! Hilde and Tania were brilliant hosts, recommending and booking restaurants for us before we arrived, and looking after us wonderfully during our stay (whilst still giving us plenty of space). The breakfast every morning was divine and set us up perfectly for a day of sightseeing - everything being very accessible from the hotel itself. Unlimited tea and coffee, and a return to a wood-burning stove burning in the communal living room, were all perfect touches that set this gem of a guesthouse apart.
reviews.title: A delicious stay in chocolate box-perfect Bruges

reviews.text: My parents and I stayed at the guesthouse for three nights earlier this month. I booked the Grey/White Room for me and the Vanilla Room for my parents.
reviews.title: Delightful retreat in the heart of a beautiful city
Gezellig! Flawless B&B
reviews.text: The rooms were both lovely and the whole house is stylishly furnished.

description: The Number 11 exclusive guesthouse is a 17th century old Bruges house located in the quiet heart of Bruges nearby the Canal.Throughout the renovations the authentic cosy atmosphere of an old historical building has been kept and at the same time provides all modern comfort.The salon and breakfast room are exclusively for the use of the guests and is overlooking the nice courtyard. Breakfast in the garden under the pergola is possible.
